reviews.review_msg: Jeremy is the best prof I've ever had. I hated math before taking this course with him and his lectures made me love math. He cares about understanding of math, not just application. And his lectures are very funny.  It is not the prof you are looking for if you want to just put numbers into the formulas though.

He cracks a lot of jokes, and engages the class. He explains things in a fast pace but still understandable. To all those complaining about him skipping stuff and him telling us to study certain things at home: welcome to university. Stuff he tells us to study at home is minimal. He was honestly such a good and helpful prof.
Reawakened my love for math

Jeremy's always happy to help, cares about his students, and always gives hints and tips on how to do well in the course. Best of all, he enjoys teaching, & is a master of the pun.   If you're mad at your math professor you're not studying hard enough.
Great prof

very engaging. he's very enthusiastic about about maths. cracks jokes frequently. very helpful if u need to understand something. goes at just the right pace during lectures, skips some details in solutions (but he does post fully worked out solutions afterwards). my first prof. my best prof (so far)!
worst prof I've ever had

Marginally easier than 151, designed for students new to calculus whereas 151 seems to be for VERY strong math students and students who have already taken some sort of calculus. As for teaching, Jeremy puts a lot of effort into engaging the class,  and does a fairly good job at teaching. Be prepared to for a lot of work, and do not slack off!

He's a young professor and every second line is "do it at home". I feel that reading the book and going online to learn calculus is a better way to go. It makes you question why you spent so much money to teach yourself math. He cracks jokes in class but it becomes frustrating when you are struggling and he says is joking like it doesn't matter
He has nice hair and he tells better jokes than my dad does.
Need to do weekly assignment to do well on quiz, first midterm was a breeze but the second destroyed half the classes marks. Praying for a bellcurve.

Jeremy is a fairly good instructor. He does go through his lectures fairly quickly, but he also brings math into the real world by showing examples of what he does. I feel like this engages me to learn more about what math can do

Really nice guy. Notes are hella messy & don't make sense if you dont show up to class. During his lectures he really pinpoints the understanding level for calculus, which helps in the far run. Tests & quizzes are straightforward. If you struggle in math, you will definitely need to seek extra help.

Tara explains concepts clearly and her notes are easy to read. She is caring about her students and spends time making sure all her students are doing well. She has a great personality and is a fun prof.
good prof, very helpful. although not mandatory, i would recommend attending lectures

She is a very good teacher who is very passionate about the subject that she teaches. Always willing to help students with topics and concepts they don't understand. Also a very nice and fun person to learn from.
He's a nice guy but you better watch youtube videos for the hard part of the course. Sometimes he doesn't explain that well.(The course needs textbook for LONCAPA and weekly quizs are important)
Amazing prof
Best prof I ever had!

The midterms were somewhat similar to the homework and quizzes so pay attention to those. Does not require a textbook but you have to pay for WebAssign. Really helpful during office hours and the YouTube video are very similar to lectures. If you can, do take a class with him.

Do not let my grade reflect how amazing of a prof this guy is. I went to the calc workshop ONCE the day before the final and he answered my question so thoroughly and without any rush even though it was PACKED. He made learning calculus feel much less daunting.

The best prof one can ever have. He explains really well and uses online tools for good visualisation. He has youtube videos so no worries if you miss a lecture. Addresses queries or doubts really quick and efficiently.

- has online yt vids if u ever skip (try not to)
- exams are all fair, and as long as you do the web assign without cheating and crowdmark without cheating ur fine for the tests
- has lots of exam resources
- weekly quizzes are very easy if you do your homework
- full 50 min lectures
- do practice exams that he gives
very good at explaining concepts and cares for the students. tests are difficult but weekly quizzes were okay. lots of self-studying and practice were needed, but homework was manageable

Goated prof. His teaching style is very streamlined and organized. The pace of the course itself was also good. It was especially nice having him answer personal questions during 150 seminars, since his explanations are very clear and concise. He uses a variety of technology in his lectures too, which make them a whole lot more visual and engaging.

Great teacher, goes over concepts slowly and carefully, making them pretty easy to understand. Midterms are exactly what you expect, so as long as you do the assignments, you can be prepared for both the exams and the quizzes. During seminars, he answers any question you might have and shows you multiple ways to solve questions.
In prof Jungic class currently, I use Jamies vids to help me understand better. Jamie must teach cal 1 for first semester students as taking it with any1 else is horrible and demotivating.
Cool teacher
Amazing Professor! Highly Recommend!!!

Honestly a really amazing prof! I don't know why the negative feedback, he is a gem. The quizzes are from the homework but the numbers are changed, he gives a lot of hints to what will be on the exams, pay attention to his wording: "If you do Question x from page y you'll be good for the test tmrw." Go to office hours talk to him, he motivated me.
Explains concepts clearly. The lectures are uploaded online as well, so attendance is not mandatory.

Clear about what will be on the exams. Some text questions are taken straight from notes, gives hints as well.  Expects you to do the work, know the concepts and understand what you're doing.  Midterms were easier than final.  Explains things well in lecture, but you have to pay attention.

Avoid this prof if you want to pass. Class average on all tests was an F, final was brutal, toughest test I have taken yet.  Like others have said did not sync with Loncapa and often skipped steps while doing examples or entire chunks of lectures. Only 2 or 3 exam questions were from the lectures fyi. Prepare to be scolded after every exam by him.

He is very clear on what will be on the midterm and final. Attend his lectures, especially the ones leading up to exams because he will give out lots of hints. Word problems on exams are identical to the ones he goes over in lecture. Overall, a very easy prof who wants his students to do well.

This prof expects too much of students. He will often skip steps in his examples and will expect you to understand how he got it. First midterm was hard while the second midterm was more reasonable(He thought it was easy for us). Can often be confusing with the methods he uses.
Takes questions for the midterm almost identically from the lecture notes.
His test are very hard and question are super hard i would not  take a class with him again. He skips part of the steps and tells you its for homework. Great guy overall but just can not teach.

Lectures are straight from the book and will skip chunks so you have to learn them yourself. Does not keep up with online portion so read ahead. His tests are also hard and in some cases unfair with questions that aren't related to the course . Also limited office hours. Very unhelpful only take him if you plan on self teaching or are good at math.
Nice professor
Just suggest go to the office hours! Great prof.

Joanna cares for everyone's success and takes the time to teach us concepts. She goes over challenging concepts in depth and if someone does not understand she will go over it again. I recommend taking Math 150 with her she's a fantastic teacher.

Joanna is such a magical unicorn from my dreams. She was so lovely to teach MATH 150. However, you must work hard in this class to receive a grade in the A range because Joanna has many quizzes and three exams covering many class materials.

Joanna was a good prof, provided tons of examples and laid out clearly what the midterms and final would be like. For the exams I would say review the seminar assignments, do the practice exams, and go over some homework questions and you'll be good.

Joanna had a lot of mistakes in her notes, and gets mad at students when they correct her. Also, instead of recording her lectures she just tells you to watch jamie's lectures instead.

Honestly, her lectures aren't worth attending. You're better off watching jamie's online lectures. Just show up for the quizzes :)
She is a very nice and caring professor, and provides good feedback on quizzes.
Only issue with course is group work got a bit annoying. Professor was clear though.
Fairly easy course, but some people found tough.
I wasnt even in calc 1 with Mackenzie, she subbed in for my calc 3 class for a week and she was far better than my normal professor. Hopefully she could teach calc 3 permanently
Mackenzie knew the material pretty well. She was patient with the doubts. The midterms and final were fair. Overall, a great learning experience from her.
Straightforward and organized lectures, quizzes were easy and the midterms + final were reasonable. Easy to talk to outside of class for help at office hours and calc workshop.
So far, the best prof I've had at SFU.

Extremely super duper kind. So compassionate towards first year students, many profs can be intimidating but she makes sure to be approachable in every way. You genuinely feel comfortable asking her questions. I felt safe in her classes. Can't recommend her enough

Took MATH 151 with her, and she was just great. Seemed to care a lot about everyone in the lecture, she respected every question, and was overall clear and concise with Calc I, which a lot of people seem to struggle with. 

So many people swear by Dr. Mulholland, but I think Mackenzie is a better professor.

Thanks to her for making 151 easy as pi!
Best prof !

Mackenzie was a good prof, although you should make sure to listen and attend lectures so you don't fall behind. Exams and quizzes were outlined clearly. But the last week of the semester we had a different lecturer. He was very unclear and hard to understand which sabotaged a whole unit for many others besides myself.

If Mackenzie has a million fans, then I am one of them. If Mackenzie has only one fan then that is me. If Mackenzie has no fans, then that means I am no longer on earth. If the world is against Mackenzie, then I am against the world.

Nah but seriously, she's a really great prof. Super patient, lectures are very easy to follow, and she cares a lot.

Mackenzie is very kind and welcoming to questions and concerns. She was helpful in office hours and clearly cares about her students' success. Lectures are good but you need to pay close attention or you will miss key steps. Quizzes are tough. Seminar questions are your key to success. She did not curve/scale which I believe is uncommon for Calc.
Super nice, friendly, and open to answering questions!
Oh I love this woman
I like her little math memes on every slide lol, I'm a month in the semester and honestly I'm enjoying my time during her classes!

Dr.Carr is absolutely amazing. I hadn't taken a calculus course before I took MATH150, so it was definitely a steep/difficult learning curve. I absolutely bombed the first midterm, and I can say for certain that I would not have passed this course if I had any other prof. Mackenzie is kind, caring, engaging and was always available to ask questions

Didn't attend lectures much but she was really nice and patient with explaining concepts. I found the second midterm challenging but the final was fair. although the seminars were annoying to go to, i found them useful plus they were free marks. I think she is one of the better math profs especially bc she's younger and understand her students.

She is a great professor. Very good teacher with clear expectations and a very organized teaching style.
Her classes are fun and she herself is very approachable and answers all questions with extra care. One of the best profs I had so far.

Mackenzie is an amazing instructor and her lectures are very understandable and easy to follow. She is always available to answer questions to the best of her ability and she provides many opportunities for students to learn the materials as best as possible. For example, there are quizzes each week to test your weekly knowledge as well as seminar.

Mackenzie is a great prof who genuinely cares about her students. She does an excellent job explaining concepts & takes the time to make sure you understand things in office hours. Course is organized well & any resource you could need is provided. Highly recommend.

I didn't really attend her lectures and when I did I noticed she was very good at explaining stuff. I always emailed her with my questions and she always responded to them. She is very kind and cares about her students and helped me alot when I had some difficulties. For her weekly quizzes I feel like she should've spent more than 10 minutes.

Professor Mackenzie Carr is an amazing professor, I could not have thought of having a better professor for this course. She makes this course easier by being very approachable, caring and good at explaining concepts. The way she organized the course is very clear, everything is easy to find on Canvas and lots of material to practice on!!

For her first semester teaching I felt like MacKenzie did great. I went and talked to her a lot during office hours and she was really good at explaining topics one-on-one. If you want a prof that cares about you doing well in your course I would take a class with her.

Mackenzie was knowledgeable in the material, approachable, responded well to questions, and a good speaker. However, I felt she spent more time explaining the steps of her arithmetic and spent less time explaining key concepts. This might be improved for example if she walked around more and used a laser pointer to highlight WHY things happen.
Good prof, although his online course presentation is hurt by how much time he spends trying to answer every question instead of finishing the lecture on time. Sooo uhh.... any questions about this?
THE BEST PROF EVER

-VERY boring and unclear due to his thick accent -midterm was fair, final was brutal -must teach yourself everything in order to pass -loncapa homework is mostly fair, ask ta in open lab for help -if you did well in grade 12 calc you'll be good to go -ta in open lab taught me everything i know
The course itself is easy, and he is an easy marker but his English needs improvement, which sometimes I could hardly understand what he is saying.
Lectures are from powerpoints, awesome for people who already knew material or cannot always come to class.   One of the easier MATH 150 teachers.
LOVE THE GUY. His accent is brilliant and he makes each class enjoyable by reading straight from the text book word for word. His exams are child's play, class average was 90%... everyone loved him.
UNREAL PROF HE IS A MUST HAVE. BY THE END OF THE YEAR YOU WILL LOVE HIM

He's a nice prof and his midterms are fairly easy. However, he misled us on the final. He said the questions won't be harder than the review questions. I did the review questions, but the final was nothing like it. It was so much harder.

He goes by the material really quickly and it's hard to keep up but he links you to online math videos offered by distance education and they are extremely helpful. Aside from that, he's extremely generous, very helpful and easy to talk to. He will guide you to specific resources and make sure that your question is well answered before you leave.
Go to her office hours, she really does a good job explaining things to you.

Brenda is very clear in lecture, and a great help in the workshop. She has really tough exams though. Great professor, but you'll be doing a fair amount of work if you want to get a good grade in her course.
Excellent and well done.

The course itself is hard and in her exam she pushes questions to the next level to see if you understand. Will do decent if you have practiced questions and studied. Quiz & homework are basic practice but nothing like her exam so practice up!  Shes a good prof but again the mark highly varies depending on the effort you put in. Will fail if slack.

Lectures are super clear, and if you miss a lecture she posts the video online.  Homework not mandatory but very helpful.  The tests can be a little bit tricky, as like a usual math prof she sometimes throws curve-ball questions, but for the most part she was a good prof.

As a lecturer, shes the best one I had. Not only asking for questions after every topic, but also explained everything nicely. People complained about her tests being hard, but it really isn't (both midterms' avg was around 48% but the range of marks was 5% - 95%). Overall, nice prof I had along the semester. It's better to attend all the lectures.

She's quite good at expressing her ideas. Funny in lectures and lets students ask questions after she explains problems. Her Midterms are very easy when you've been to every lecture and followed her notes. The week quizzes are a pain. Overall, great prof.

Both midterms averages are currently 47%.  Lectures spends 50min on material you learn 20min yourself. Skip unless you are a slow learner. Homework content are irrelevant towards exams content.  If you aren't prepare to learn 80% of the content yourself, be prepared to be the average 47er.  I am above average but it's not worth  the time.

Shes a pretty great instructor but just following her lectures won't give good marks, got to just practice math questions outside the lecture. Shes nice and helpful, willing to help, clear. Her iclickers give you hope but midterms were HARD (47% and 48% avg). Hopefully she scales to at least 60% because MATH154 getting 70%+ avg in MTs.
very good teacher. connects with students, and is interested in the topic at hand. answers every question clearly.
She is the best math prof i have seem so far. she really tries to explain things. highly recommend

Davison (for math 150 at least) posts math lecture outlines online. Then you attend the lectures and essentially fill the outlines out. This is excellent for studying for finals, because all your notes will be organized by date, topic, and section. She is perfectly clear in lecturing as well

This prof wasn't as bad as I thought she was in the beginning. She came off very nice but the way she taught the material in the beginning of the class was MUCH harder than if I looked in the book or went to the TAs. Overall, pretty good prof, but her exams are a little on the difficult side.
The quizzes and midterm were really easy. The final mark scaling makes the course really easy
Amazing professor. Lectures were entertaining at times, and she was very helpful and encouraged questions. During office hours she would help you with any problem you had.

Absolutely outstanding professor. Actually took the time to answer students questions and gave satisfactory answers. She was available outside of the class for extra help at calculus support sessions. Last, but not least she kept the class interesting and you could tell math is her passion. You want this professor!

Solid math professor. She explained the concepts pretty clearly in class, and gave easy marks in the form of iclickers and weekly quizzes. If you read the textbook her lecture is fine. All in all one of the better profs I've had.
great prof, he was excellent at explaining things until you proved to him you understood. Not sure if he's still teaching math, but if anybody gets the chance to take a class with him, DO IT!

he explains everything so that you not only know how to do the problems, but so that you understand the concepts as well. and he explains in a such a way that it sticks. for example, he uses visual aids on the computer to demonstrate visually, the concepts which are taught, instead of just proving concepts with abstract equations. great teacher
I'm an international student and I wasted $2000 on this course. Easily the worst investment of my life!
By far the worst mathematics professor at SFU. Unfair and judgemental! Highly unclear and boring!
He has a sense of humor and explains things quite well. I enjoy his classes. Math is tough though so if you don't put in your side of the work you won't do well.
Great prof with materials explained pretty well. Go to lectures and ask questions is the way to get good grades.
Nice guy, and very funny :P

He?s a great prof and a great human being in general; he is funny, helpful, and approachable. He explains the material very well (I never really did understand math until KM) and is always available for extra help. The assignments are lengthy at times but that?s for all math classes. The midterms are fair but the final exam is HARD, so be prepared.
exam is hard and little bit unfair. however he is funny prof.

Great professor. Very engaging. Presents the material in a clear and digestible way. Uses lots of examples in lecture, many drawn partially or completely from the text. Great use of supplementary materials in class (interactive graphs and visual reference for word problems). Highly recommend taking a class with him.
Browsing through this site, never revied him so here I go.BEST PROF AT SFU BAR NONE.
Very helpful, easy to interact with, uses real life examples which is usually quite helpful in math.

Jamie is an amazing professor. His explanations are super clear and he makes everything very easy to understand. He is very organized and gives you lots of practice tests for the midterms and the final. I would definitely recommend taking a course with him if you have the chance. He made the class very fun.

Hes just the goat. He makes math enjoyable and fun somehow. Lots of quizzes which are straight from the homework. Midterms and final were fair, just do the practice exams and the practice. I wouldve loved attending lectures if it wasnt at 830am. Youtube videos came in clutch! Loved this class

Jamie himself is fine as a lecturer, especially since he has the entire course as a youtube playlist. However, there's an insane amount of weekly homework and quizzes which are barely worth anything. If you're unfamiliar with any pre-cal concepts you're going to find yourself struggling to keep up. Overall I don't get the hype.
gave me an extension cuz i forgot also great overall

Honestly a very good professor. The reason I received a fairly low mark is because honestly, I didn't put in enough work to get a B or an A, but all of the resources are there to succeed. Make sure to watch his YouTube videos (even if you aren't in his class) as they were helpful in exam prep.

I had some random surrey prof for my math 150 online course, who literally didn't lecture us once and just had us watch Jamie's lectures. That being said, Jamie was amazing. As someone who doesn't usually understand or enjoy math, he really made things accessible and did a great job explaining. Anyone who takes a math class with him is lucky!

BY FAR, the best prof at SFU. Friendliest guy in the world. He isn't one of those profs that are only there for research. This guy cares about teaching and his students. If he's teaching you MUST take his course. This is calculus so be prepared to do a ton of work but Jamie is one of the few that make this course understandable.

Took his class a year ago on my first semester. So far the best prof I have ever seen in SFU! He is super friendly and helpful in class, willing to answer your questions. Also he has youtube videos to record his lectures so don't worry if you miss any knowledge point. If he teaches any other courses, I would definitely take that course!

Jamie is probably the best teacher that I've ever had. His passion for the subject matter is palpable and it really draws you in and makes you WANT to learn (as opposed to the usual NEED to learn feeling).

Jamie Mulholland is definitely one of the best profs at SFU.  Although his material is challenging, as to be expected in a math class, he is very helpful and respectful of his students and their questions.  He makes math interesting and relevant and definitely does his best to make sure that his students are understanding the content.
Best math prof
Amazing professor, has a vivid passion for mathematics.

makes youtube videos to help students learn. You can tell that he enjoys teaching and some of his research is actually focused on that. midterms were okay but final was pretty brutal (class average before final was highish). uses hard questions for quiz. That said, the prof rekindled some of my interest in math and is friendlyhelpful one on one.
The best math prof at sfu. Very clear and detailed explanations. Always willing to help and answer questions

Best prof ever. Took math 150 two semesters ago and had waited for him to teach Calc 2 for this upcoming semester. It doesn't matter what class it is, or what time it's at, if Jamie's the teacher, then take it. You simply can't and won't regret it even if you get a bad mark. Even in 350 characters, I don't think that he can be praised enough LOL.

Jamie is the best professor that I've ever had. He makes everything crystal clear to understand. He has a great method of teaching and if you want to see what kind of guy he is check out this video "Jamie Mulholland - 2011 Teaching Excellence Awards" on youtube. I will take any class that he is teaching.

Takes a long time to get the point across, and does so in an unclear fashion, if you like this sort of thing, like reading run-on sentences like this, then you will love his teaching style, I couldn't handle it, and will go to great lengths to never take a class with him again
unlike all math teachers he has a very king manner.
He was awesome, and so nice! He class was pretty hard tho, but its college calculus, thats expected!
He is a very helpful teacher, and he loves what he does. I will take any math course that I can with him.
great teacher!!!!
BEST MATH PROF EVER!

Extremely helpful and clear prof. His midterms are similar to the practice ones, but the textbook "hard" examples are a good prep. His notes are amazing and clear and he is always willing to help out students in the workshops. Great prof for first year calc students!
best prof ever

Simply amazing! Dr. Mulholland is by far the best math professor I've had. Exams are very fair (not easy though). He made coming to 8:30 lectures enjoyable and always kept the class entertained by telling jokes. He also applied concepts to real life so that they were easier to understand. If you need to take a math course, take it with him!

Wow, What a great prof, I had no interest in Calculus before taking this course and was very nervous comming into the class. He has been such a great teacher it has sparked my interest in math. Very straight forward, Very interesting, and very helpful. The tests are not easy but very fair. Best Prof I have had!!!
AWESOME prof. I recommend him to everyone taking calculus. HE REALLY KNOWS HIS STUFF and + HE CAN TEACH very well. Probably one of the best profs here at SFU!!! VERY FAIR!
Only good if you have never taken Calculus before (ie: you didn't take it in high school) otherwise his lectures and the little details will bore you every class.
Excellent teacher. Explains concepts fully and always there to lend a hand at the workshop.

Excellent Prof. very nice and great in explaining the concepts. Have assignments AND online assignments to hand in every week, which was very exhausting but great for practice. Love the online videos, which is great if you missed lectures. just try and you'll do fine

very clear... i'd say attend the lectures cuz it helps a lot... he posts videos online but then it might not be him teaching and the words are harder to see... he's very chill too! he made math interesting for me...
If every Prof was this good, I'd never leave school.  Amazing clarity.  Extremely helpful and patient.  GREAT prof.

He is the best of the best Prof I have met so far in sfu....This course is tough since it's a MATH(Calculus) class but if you do your paper assignment/Loncapa, and attend calculus workshop you will probably pass this class foshooo

BEST PROF i've ever had at SFU. first time commenting on here which shows how good of a prof he is! notes are very clear! exams are easy, just study his past midterms/exams. SO much better than other math profs! however, this course was very time consuming but worth it. I actually understood everything he taught us.

What most Math profs are missing is the fact they don't teach the reasonings behind using this & that formulas, or why it works. This professor, Mulholland, however, does that, and greatly enhances the class' & my understanding for math. Calc 150 was made out to be a lot easier than it really is because of that key ingredient in his teaching.
Super duper prof!!! Long assignments but what do you expect from Math. Explains material thoroughly EVERY single class! The final exam got me, definitely practice ALL the sample exams he posts up.

In all honesty, the best professor I've ever had at SFU.  Very helpful, respectful, approachable, knowledgeable.  I personally liked his personality and sense of humour, which kept me going during lectures (it is still Math, after all).  Midterms are fair, as a few questions that were on the review package end up on the test.  Take Math with him!

Dr. Jamie is an excellent prof. His notes are very clear. Love his notes! I love his way of teaching and he's very helpful at all times. If you do your review packages and attend every class, you won't have any problems receiving good marks on midterms and finals :D Very nice guy! Hope I have him in my other math classes in the future.

Jamie is a fantastic prof; heads and shoulders about the other professor's I've had at SFU so far.  He's always willing to help out, and he keeps things interesting by using examples and graphics along with the lecture material. He's also always available during office hours (and doesn't mind staying late if need be).  Thanks Dr. Mulholland!
Very good prof. Notes are great and clear.   Answers all questions well. Extremely interested in topics.
Awesome teacher

good teacher! young guy, really helpful! very approachable and likes to somewhat go off on a tangent. really good! recommended! I think he knows physics, chem, and computing science as well as math so he's well rounded!
young good guy. good prof. cares about students. recommended.

I really enjoyed Mrs. Menz's class.  She is tough, but she genuinely seems to enjoy the material she teaches, and her passion makes lectures less dull (but I mean... how exciting could a calc lecture be?).  There is lots of homework, but I really think that it helped with preparation for the final exam.

Expects a lot from her students, but does not give them the time or tools they need to actually meet her expectations. Her teaching style is rushed and extremely difficult to follow. If you are unfortunate enough to get stuck with her as a prof, here's a tip: skip lectures and watch Jamie Mulholland's Math 150/151 series on YouTube instead.
I walked into the lecture hall and I was Petrafied. End of story.

Awesome and touche prof. She is inspiring and caring(if you can prove to be respectable). She even pulled some bad/mean comments on this site to to laugh it off with the class in lecture. Her lectures are fast but clear, she is also very knowledgeable in the material. btw you get roasted in class if you don't study and slack off.
Tried her best to make concepts clear and easy to understand but alot of the time she would rush and make it more difficult. Tests are very theory based.
Amazing Teacher

Do your homework regularly, and some of the questions from the textbook appear again in the quizzes and midterms. The midterms are graded quite fairly, but I got 0 for 1 question in which I only got one line of the graph wrong. Anyways, she is easy with all the tests, study her notes well and you will get high grades easily. Highly recommended.
She's difficult. Nuff said.

If math isnt your strong suit dont take 150 with Pedro. He makes many mistakes during lectures and he mumbles all the time. His excuse for his mistakes is because I didnt have enough coffee. Also his English is extremely weak for a professor and can not communicate properly. Pedro didnt even provide answer keys for practice exams...

Pedro is a very nice guy and really cares about his students. I think the class I took was one of his first in english, and regarding that, it was fairly good. He always did his best to help you, and was quick to respond to emails. Not the absolute clearest at explanations, but a better choice than other profs.

Prof is really nice and gets back to emails quickly. Always willing to help and genuinely cares about his students' success. However, his lectures could be improved- he mumbles and his writing is occasionally hard to read. To be honest: the lecture videos online are easier to understand than his lectures. Tests are extremely fair in my opinion

Took MATH150 with him last semester. If this was his first class in English, then it was very good. He truly tries to teach all of the material although get ready to watch videos at times. I would prefer that he spoke louder and clearer, but that comes with teaching experience. Applications, tg problems, not much knowledge of formulas, and param.
Genuinely nice guy but his lectures are horrible. Frequently gets corrected by students and does not explain certain topics very well.

Explains things well and is super resposnsive to emails and goes out of his way to clarify questions. sometimes a bit disorganized and talks quietly but other than that he's a good prof. Many ppl didn't like him because they did poorly in the class bc the exams(which werent written by him) were difficult. Overall 8/10 would take again

Pedro's lectures were bad and okay at best. By the middle of the semester, everyone bailed on the lectures because they weren't helping out much. Tons of mistakes made during lectures. If your math is not great, don't take pedro.

Pedro is the best all those bad reviews are salty lol. He's super caring and replies to emails quickly. He's always happy to help with questions. pls give him a good rate he deserves it 10/10 would take again. my suggestion for people taking this course is to start on homework early, do a section a day. :) pedro is meme god
Really need the knowledge of calculus from highschool with this guy. Picky marking. Interesting character, but dont take his class if you didnt take calc in hs.

He has no idea of what he is teaching in class and constantly keeps asking the students for help. The material he teaches and what we get in the tests and midterm are nowhere related and the marking is really tough. Worst prof ever.

He gives very hard exams. He mumbles a lot during lectures and speaks very quietly. He also messes up a lot on example questions when giving lectures. He's an interesting guy, but I would recommend taking his class only if you have previous and sufficient knowledge of calculus. Otherwise, you will suffer. The class average on the midterm was 50%.
He the best!
She was super nice, notes and lectures were sometimes disorganized, but she replied to inquiries quickly and gave fair exams, so I won't complain too much

Had her for calc 1, she was decent. A bit of a stuttery talker and notes were kinda messy, but she was super kind and supportive, and I thought the lectures were good. She took the time to get to know students individually too, which I loved

Sophie is really nice, but I ended up relying on recorded lectures by other professors to get through this course. Not really her fault but the classes were too early and didn't see a point in attending lectures.

Sophie is caring and passionate about what she teaches but I don't think 50 min lectures are enough for her. She does tend to get "carried" away and it does confuse people in the class as i have seen from the other ratings. Other than that she is available outside of class and provides many recourses to get help from.

Sophie judges genuine questions that are asked during class time (and responds condescendingly), and also sometimes judges people's intelligence based on what they look like. She offers lots of extra help outside class though. Homework isn't super challenging. The midterms aren't too bad as long as you study. The final is kind of terrible though.
Get ready for questions that you've never seen in assignments or quizzes!
Average. A lot of homework as well as a hard marker!

Sophie is a decent prof. Sure, the workload is a little heavy, but thats what comes with a 4 credit course. She is calm, caring, and good at explaining concepts and going through relevant examples. Assessments are fair, but the 10 minute weekly quizzes are stressful. Stay on top of your work from day 1 and youll be just fine.

I find this course with Sophie pretty average. Weekly homework assignments to do and fairly easy weekly quizzes. Exams are of fair difficulty. I personally did not find her lectures very great so I used another profs lectures. Overall not good but also not bad. Average.

Not a math person. 4cr course w/ heavy workload. Not her fault. 8/10 for effort. Lecture videos+optional zoom sessions during sched times, relevant practice Q# from textbook, etc. 1/10 for Execution. Frequent mistakes in vids. Also goes off topic SO MUCH. Half of any lectureuhh ahh uh. Writing is hard to read. I used a diff prof's lecs instead.

Homework via Webassign is trivial if you read the textbook and use google. Quizzes are easy if you put in the work to understand too: beware submission issues since this was an online class; enough with the excuses about not enough time. Midterm 1 was way too hard, 2 was easy, Final was about alright. Her lectures aren't the best - some mistakes.

Extremely hard class especially if you've never taken calculus before. Four assignments a week and a quiz on Friday where you get a 0 if you submit 1 second late. Her lectures are useless but at least they are optional; just watch Mulholland and Organic Chemistry Tutor videos to learn the content. Not enough time for midterms/final.

Pretty average calculus professor. Nothing really stood out; lectures were okay (I decided to watch Jamie Mullholand's calculus videos as they were much better) but lots of after-lecture assignments. However, they are useful because they drill the concepts into your head. Responds to emails quickly and offers lots of help outside of class.

She made lessons for us that were on youtube and they were confusing. She made mistakes in the videos which were not corrected. The things that were marked were exams, web assignments and quizes. I ended up watching a different professor's videos.

Run down of class: daily assignments, weekly review assignments, a quiz on Friday and don't forget there's a lecture video to watch even though you just did a quiz. If you submit a quiz before/on the deadline, but the system processes it a second late: too bad, you get a 0. Even if we can see the time stamps, that it's uploaded and submitted before

Here's the truth people. She acts like you know calculus and for worse she even gives you homework almost daily which isn't that bad. But lets say she teaches you section 3.3 stuff today , but BAD THING IS the homework is on 3.5 which you'll have to teach yourself for some reason. Acts like we only have her class. Tip: do textb qs, youtube, GL!

This class is 4-credit so expect to work harder than other Calculus 1 classes, dont apply your 3-credit class standard here. Though lots of work, everything is manageable and pretty fun actually. Sophie is not really that great of a lecturer, but all the examples and assignments she gives will provide you with solid understanding of the concepts

Sophie is really a great prof. Lots of these reviews are from first-year Calc students, (like myself), who aren't used to the uni work load. As someone who is mathematically inclined I found her lectures interesting and really well explained. She is a very caring and kind teacher and definitely puts in the effort to make sure her students succeed.

I would not recommend anyone to take this class. She expects way too much from her students and expects us to know how to do Calc. There's homework due almost everyday and there's only 40 minutes to do the midterms (plus 10 minutes of uploading). This course is worth 4 credits, but it's definitely not worth the time and effort. Take a another class

Sophie is very nice, but all her lectures are online + pre-recorded. She often rambles and has very illegible handwriting. Frequently makes small errors in the lecture notes. She even recommends that we do not watch her lectures and instead watch those of another, much more highly rated, professor. Assignments are due almost every day of the week.
the goat at rambling and not teaching

Prof doesn't teach at all, will send you a different profs lecture videos because nobody can understand the way she explains, do not take her class unless you want to be confused. Terrible explainer who acts like we have all taken calc before, lots of work on your own time, so be ready to add 4+ hours of your day w/o lectures and homework to calc

One of the worst teachers Ive ever had in my life. She assumes you to know everything. She had to upload videos of a different prof doing the lectures because no one was getting the math. Her midterms are a timed 50 minutes and have about 30 questions in them that take longer than 50 min todo.

Professor offers a poor education, and makes many errors during her lectures that can cause confusion. Hard grade and makes all assignments due the same day at 10pm which isnt fair considering you have to watch the lecture then 1-3 hours of YouTube to even grasp the content of the homework, find a different professor
Tough grader, many hours of YouTube and homework on top of lectures, lectures are very poor quality (especially online w bad audio/connection issues), better to find an alternative professor.

Not a great explainer tends to be too vague, would recommend trying to get another prof if you want to do well or spend hours on YouTube or paying for a tutor. Decently nice person not a good teacher, would be best to avoid her

Literally does not do lectures, makes us go to class and THEN watch another 1-2 hours of YouTube videos by her (with ads) on top of our own practicing. Acts like this is the only class that any of her students are taking. Terrible at explaining, and her writing is chicken scratch. The hybrid method with zoom and YouTube is trash.
This woman doesn't even offer proper lectures, if you wanna pass watch other professors' lectures. Why is this lady even a professor???
A lovely person but not a great teacher and speaker. In her recorded lectures, she rambles her ass off. Never goes into depth.

Amazing prof. Very engaging. Genuinely cares for her students. Her passion for the material makes the lectures more vivid. I love that she goes through every single step, explains what we're doing, and why we are doing it. LOTS of workload as it is a 4 units course. Exams are identical to lect/HWs quesitons. I wish all math prof was like her.

Personable and seems to truly care about her students. Lectures were clear and helpful, worth paying attention in. Tests were reasonable, but did require some extra prep besides only homework completion. Highly recommend Sophie.

Lectures for Math 150 are essentially pointless, so might as well not show up for classes if you have this prof. For lecture notes, she literally copies off of the person who created the notes wrote. If you wonder "what's wrong with going over similar lecture notes?" Well, nothing; it's just that she can't even explain concepts well

She's mediocre. She takes forever to explain a simple concept and usually ends up explaining it poorly and running out of time. The way she explains concepts is very informal such that her explanation would just sound like something she thought off the top of her head. She also deducts marks for the smallest mistakes...

Great at explaining calculus concepts. Always cheerful and doesn't put you to sleep. I was easily able to make appointments with her to discuss any issues I had. She also attended math seminars for a more small group style of teaching. Although I switched out of the class because I was bad at math, I would totally take this class again.

This prof made me change my major to math. she is so sweet and caring and really makes a point of connecting with her students and even learning names. as it is in any math course, you must do the homework in order to excel. her exams were very fair and I really wish she taught every math course at SFU. also go to calculus workshop!! so helpful!

she is really sweet... and that's about it. the course itself is hard, and she makes it impossible to to learn anything in the lectures. Takes forever to explain a concept and often runs out of time and you have to study the rest yourself. questions solved in lectures are way easier than the ones on the test. I would NEVER take a class w her again.
Cares about her students, wants you to pass. Just attend workshops as much as you can

i have never wished to take a course online as much i did this semester takes too long to explain a simple concept and often doesn't get to finish the material so you have to learn on your own do yourself a favour and dont take it with her

Lyn was very understanding and non-judgemental of math difficulties I was having. She is so encouraging, and extremely helpful in office hours (I just wish she had more hours!). She made the dullest class in university a little bit brighter.

Very, very solid overview of Calc 1. She covered all nevessary concepts and practice problems, and the course overall had quizzes, seminars and assignments to stay updated with the material. Highly recommend.
Fantastic lecturer, I always understood the concepts she explained
She's a very good teacher who actually cares about students. This was a great experience for calc 1.

She's a very good prof for math. She goes very slowly during lectures which is a good thing and explains different concepts very well. sometimes she's hard to understand but you can always go to office hours or calculus workshop. MATH150 is a hard course with lots of hw and quizzes weekly so make sure to stay on top of those when studying!!

Theorem: Yes!!! Take it w Lyn or forever regret your life choices.
Proof: look at all the reviews :)

Lyn is very caring and wants her students to succeed. I was scared of Math but now considering to switch to engineering because of her. Exam questions match the seminar problems and assignments. If you review them, you should be fine. Definitely recommend!
Best prof ever: seriously.
Solid prof for first year calc, she's very understanding that first years are new to uni structure, and helps you adapt nicely

The class can seem fast paced, so I definitely recommend lots of practice outside of class to really lock in the concepts. Her lectures are decent, sometimes she's hard to understand, but overall pretty good. The exams matched well with the samples and the seminar questions, so overall I can recommend her
The quizzes can be a serious time crunch at first, but you get used to them, and she's pretty decent at explaining
I'm in this class rn and I can confirm it's going great, I'll admit I'm not a math major and this is one of the few math classes I'll ever need to take, but ngl I'm considering a math minor now
You can tell she knows the difficulties of student life, thus she doesn't make this class any harder than it needs to be.
Excellent teacher
Would give more than 5/5 if I could

This is your standard Calc 1 class, I do agree that her accent can be hard to understand and her writing is kinda messy, but she's a good prof and explains stuff pretty well imo, she's good overall tbh

If Lyn has a million fans, then I am one of them. If Lyn has only one fan, then that is me. If Lyn has no fans, then that means I'm no longer on Earth. If the world is against Lyn, then I am against the world.

Despite supposedly being "harder" than courses like 157, I feel like 150 is run significantly better. First, you have Lyn the goat, then you get the seminars which are incredibly helpful (shout out to the peer mentors and TAs too)! The only bad part is webassign which is frustrating to use, but that's not her fault at all as it's standardized
Her lectures are highly captivating. It is like watching magic unfold: you unlock the true beauty of the subject.

Anyone who complains just doesn't know how good they have it. She's easily the best Prof I've had in uni so far, and the consistent reviews here seem to agree. What more can you really ask for lol, fair tests and great lectures
So kind and helpful. I'd have her teach every class if she could

Her accent is very hard to understand, her writing is not clear, doesn't provide clear explanation of t
what units the quizzes are on.

During lectures it's near impossible to understand what she is saying due to her accent.
Good teaching, fair tests and quizzes, responsive to questions, you can't really ask for more.
The nicest prof you can have as a first year. Genuinely an amazing experience, she's so supportive and gives good tips not just for calculus, but for general studying. Can't recommend enough
Amazing professor

Though she has a thick french accent, she explains course content very well. In lectures after she finishes a section, she would make sure everybody is up to speed. She shines best in office hours as her explanations are very clear. The exams very in difficulty but are fair. The best way to excel is to do the practice exam package and ask questions

She was far better than other posters make her out to be. Intro calc coming straight from high school isn't supposed to be an easy. She had an accent and wrote in cursive but it was easy to get used to both. If you asked her to clarify, she would. She gave a hard 1st midterm but gave a much much easier 2nd one. 1st was only hard since I didnt study

She seems to care for her students and genuinely tried to improve after the first midterm. Her accent isn't an issue at all. Anyone who has talked to a non English speaker before will be able to understand her fine. Also nice with office hours. Hand writing could use a bit of work but you adapt to it pretty quick. Just do the homework.

Her french accent wasn't thick compared to other teachers I've had. I found her really approachable and helpful especially during her office hours. The final was challenging but still fair. Second midterm was easier. If you don't understand something it is your own responsibility to go ask for clarification. She gives clear explanations.

Can read cursive,you're ok with her. Can get used to heavy French accent, you're ok. Midterm 2 was easier(learned what to give in terms of difficulty), so future students should be ok. Pre-read since she's not great at explaining in English. If you can learn well with examples and just observation of steps (can connect each step) you're ok.

Hard to understand her speaking, and writing. Also doesn't explain some things. First midterm was too difficult, second one was much easier because she probably realized she should take it down a notch.

She's fine. She has a hard time explaining some stuff, but she usually makes up for it by showing a bunch of other different examples. She goes at a nice pace, and asks if we need any clarification at the end of each example which is appreciated . Quizzes are an easy 10%, and midterms are annoyingly specific. - Her accents the cutest thing ever.
hard midterm and never explain her work clearly, switch her or study online

If you get Amelie as your prof, either switch into Jaime Mulholland's Math 151 class or watch his lecture videos on YouTube prior to 150 lectures. Not only is she difficult to understand, but she does not explain why certain steps to question are applied; she just does them. More questions have been asked about her cursive than content itself.

Amelie has a strong French accident which makes lectures hard to understand. She lacks the expierence teaching clearly. She does not explain her teachings, rather she shows students: "this is what you do, this is how you prove it", she does not go into much detail. Her hand writing is confusing as she only writes recursively. Would not recommend.
Can't understand her at all!!!!
Don't take him if you have a chance.Lectures are unclear and does not help to prepare exam at all.

Got together with a few former classmates from SFU last weekend - great fun. Of course we spoke of our favourite classes, profs and instructors from that time. Ms. Gauthier was NOT one of them. She had a tremendous grasp of the subject but lacked in her ability to inspire.

This might be the first time Justine is teaching at SFU since there weren't any prior reviews and low enrollments. I must say Justine has been an excellent professor and does a great job at explaining the materials. There are weekly online assignments and quizzes. Don't let the lack of reviews discourage you from taking her course.

Justine was a great math prof, very charismatic and explains well to help students understand. Had a really organized canvas page with lots of helpful links. A high grade is achievable if you put in the work! Would definitely recommend taking math 150 with her, super chill prof.
Two words: BEST PROFESSOR!!!

Very nice prof. He is extremely good at teaching Calculus, however his midterm and finals are tough. You really have to study a lot for them. Free 15% on quizzes and assignments, 5% for calculus readiness test 30% for 2 midterms, and 50% for final.
great proffesor, exams are brutal, but you really do learn calculas with him!
Great Professor. The notes he gave out were crystal clear. Always available for extra help and also willing to help out students. Overall, he is one of the best professors at SFU

I'm not a calculus person. But he is great. Very clear, and if you go to lectures you will see he is very clear and caring. Take it with him. Midterms are easy, final is a bit tricky, but all the questions are from textbook. He doesn't try to trick you.
Awesome guy, super fair.
Go to lectures and practice as much as you can.
He was great 10/10
Great prof, easy to understand and has clear notes, also friendly. not exactly easy but that's more course based to most people

Dr.Drakes is one of the persons who love their job! One lecture she told us that she can play with math all day and never get bored! If you are going to take math at SFU, definately take her classes! Attending her lectures is fun!

very good lecturer, you actually LEARN STUFF from her class. The material is hard but she's a great prof to have. Always encourages questions. The course moves pretty fast though so be prepared, still she's a great teacher.
She is a nice person and her lectures are crystal, assignments and midterms are  fair, I strongly recommended.

This prof is generally grate and responsible for students. In her course, you will get 10%for assignment(the TA will mark them), as long as you did it. It is not quite difficult to get A grade or even better in her course.

Don't even know what happened in this class. Every assignment was a struggle, and exams always consisted of questions that were too challenging and long for that amount of time. Lectures were also unnecessarily fast, and concepts were not introduced well. I pretty much learned everything on my own since lectures were too fast to follow.
Decent professor, midterms were somewhat fair and final was not the worst. Would recommend doing the seminar questions and the webassign as those will make sure you know what you are doing
I didn't like her initially, but once I started putting in some effort and just did my work I began to like her, and she was pretty helpful in tutorials. Reccomend taking her

Dr. Kouzniak has good lectures and her notes are very thorough, despite not finishing them on occasion. Offers lots of resources and office hours to succeed. However, the Math150 seminars were another story, as you'd get berated for not knowing how to do problems. Very hostile learning environment in the seminars, make sure u prepare well.

Midterms and finals were difficult. Quizzes consisting of 2 questions every week affect the average by 10 percent. If you wanna study 15 hours per week just for math then take it, otherwise pass this prof.

she is a great lecturer when she does finish notes, but most of the times she didnt. i liked her bc she was organized and offered video lecs w notes. however, seminars were an absolute nightmare. expect to get yelled at least once everytime ur in there. id only recommend math150 if u have no calc exp. if you do, take 151 instead and save ur sanity

I feel Dr. Kouzniak gets a lot of hate that she does not deserve. Although I did not get the grade I wanted, I had to respect her effort to really encourage students to do well. What I really enjoyed about her was the amount of resources from videos to seminar answer sheets. She pushes people alot which for some may seem bad, but she is just caring

She never finished a lecture fully and always had trouble managing her time. Very harsh towards those who would ask questions whether it was mid-class or office hours. She was an okay prof when it came to teaching but everything had to be solved her way or lots of marks would be deducted.

Great lectures and explanations. This class is a LOT of work and fast paced!! You need to put in the effort to do well. She can be slightly intimidating but will always try to ensure you understand the content. Midterms and final were fair but not easy.

Math 151 and lectures are fine. Don't take Math 150 with her. She comes to seminars, yells when work is not her style. Instead of two seminar questions that are due, expects you to bring entire seminar draft. Yelled at boy for being 2 min late about his bad midterm. Big difference in seminars with her and in Burnaby where its just TA and calm.

This class overall is a very heavy course load, and Natalia gave a lot of resources and information to help students. She was very accessible and put a lot of effort in to helping students improve. Overall I would say she is a great prof, just beware that Math 151 itself is difficult.

gave lots of resources, responded to emails quickly, lectures were helpful, overall an amazing prof. bad reviews are mostly from course content and have nothing to do with natalia's actual teaching ability, she listens to student feedback and tests are fair. Great prof overall

Dr. Kouzniak is a solid professor. Very easy midterms and decent quizzes if you study the material as all the content are questions from the weekly assignments. Funny during lectures, but just make sure it isn't at your expense! Try to attend all lectures leading up to the finals as she may give hints for the hard questions on assignments.
Amazing professor! seriously cares about her students and provides constructive criticism. Can be a bit harsh but she just wants the best. She is also hilarious!

Good professor. Friendly, very accessible and happy to make time for students to discuss their grades or answer questions, tries to engage the class and keep things interesting by asking questions during class instead of just reading off the slides.
Pyke is a very nice professor who tries to explain things in simple ways. However, he often makes mistakes which may be misleading/confusing.
Horrible save your money and sanity

Dr. J cares so much about student success, but this class was hard. I was an A student in high school Pre-Calc and got a C with a lot of hard work. If you do every homework assignment and go to most office hours you can pass the course because Dr. J will respect your effort.
Horrible. Will never take a math class with him. Messy notes, incomplete, extremely hard tests and grading.

Incredibly hard for a first year course. Veselin jungic doesnt help either. He just says keep studying and good things will happen. I did that and he told me to drop the class. Even though I tried and needed help, he just answers 1 question in office hours from u and moves on. Hes a bad prof and dont get me started with the TAs. :(

The most honest review u can get is here. Veselin jungic is not caring , as he told people to drop the class if they failed test 1. His TAs mark harshly and make sure the average is 55%. He himself remarked the tests since the average was like 65% one time. His notes r messy. He doesnt finish them. You will need to teach urself. Just avoid him.
The online course has definitely made this course a lot harder than it should be, but Dr. Jungic tried to help us out as much as he could.

Such a bad experience as a first year first semester student in SFU. This class was tough but Prof Jungic made it much harder. If the question was whats 1+1 and u write 2. You will get 2/5 as the other 3 marks will come from why it equals 2. Like the amount of explaining and marks it takes up is a joke. I would never take a class with him again.

Maybe Some would say he is a caring guy, But he was not a good prof. Please avoid this class at all cost. Calculus is already a difficult course and this prof does not make it the slightest bit easier, in fact is probably 10x harder than it should be. AVOID!

The online semester is difficult for everyone, and although there were some technical difficulties; Dr. Jungic and his team are always available for help. You must study for his exams since questions on his exam are can be easily misinterpreted. Math 150-course load is heavy due to his daily assignment that can be tedious.

Ignore these one star reviews. I agree his teaching may not be clear sometimes, but there's a reason he posts external resources to help clarify topics. Besides his second term test, the tests were fair and doable. The WebAssign assignments help you boost your mark and gives a lot of extra practice for the term tests/final. Would recommend.

Calculus 1 is always a difficult course, and the final in this class was insanely difficult. That being said, calculus is hard no matter who the prof is. In my opinion, Dr. J is a fantastic prof. He is very kind and is always willing to help students out, replies quickly on piazza, and is very accessible outside of class. Just study hard!

I went through this class purely off of Dr. Mulholland's YouTube videos. Lectures are horrid at 8am. Dr. Jungic tried his best to make his tests anti-cheat for online, but made them confusing in the process. Final was insanely difficult. Very caring professor who's lenient with part marks, and probably one of the better Calculus teachers out there.
I dont recommend this prof.

I dont know how I got a B- but I did. This class isnt what it was once. Remote classes really just stepped up their levels. Highly avoid taking MATH 150 online and wait until its back in person. Prof. J showed that he clearly cant teach online with his incredibly messy notes and extremely hard tests.

If I was on an island with the only way to get off it is to take this prof. I wouldnt. Why should I? With extremely difficult tests/exams, barely any time for them, horrible connection, messy notes, always confusing, never finishing the notes, leaving us to self learn from Jamie, going in unprepared always with no practice review, just a huge no.

Will never take a class with this prof again. Had high hopes as before remote classes Dr. j was considered a legend. With my first year experience, what a horrible choice. The other section had a much higher avg as Dr.J just told people to drop the class. Hes not meant for online teaching at all. Hes making me even consider not doing a math class

Dr. j is not caring at all. I dont understand what people mean by that. If he was so caring, why did he tell those who failed test 1 to drop the class and those who failed test 2 to also drop it to get some sort of refund. He should be encouraging others to keep trying, yes he does reply to questions but most profs do also. Hes just bad overall.

The tests were extremely hard, especially the final exam. Also Jamie Mulholland's pre recorded lectures are much more useful than the live lectures. This class is much harder due to being online and I would recommend waiting until class resumes in person. However, Dr. J is extremely caring and also replies to messages. His office hours were useful.

I failed... well I will never take a class with this prof again. Horrible experience as a first year student at SFU. Not only does he do everything against you such as the time you have for exams/tests/quizzes, the notes he gives, the TA marking, but he also doesnt care if you pass. Hes so scared of people cheating yet then dont give tests.

HOW IS HE CARING!? He said after test 2 if you are failing drop the class and re take it. Meaning get a 40% refund and pay again so they can get more money out of you. If he was so caring he would actually try to help you pass not tell you to drop out. The fact that you need to teach yourself shows how bad Prof J is. Avoid at all costs!

What a joke of a prof. The exam was unfair, his tests were unfair besides the last one he gave us. the average is so low. No curve, no scale. If u get a D u cant take MATH 152. He doesnt care if you fail but rather he has stated to drop the class if you are failing to retake it and waste even more money.

What a final exam. All that practice work he gave us just for nothing to be on it. No point in studying. This class is study on your own after attending the lecture to be confused. Almost everyone relied on YouTube/Jamie. The average was a 55%. Think about that. The online precede is a killer for MATH 150. Wait until it resumes in person.

I got a decent mark in this class but that wasnt bc he was a good teacher I had gotten almost 100% on calc in high school. Hes lectures are a waste of time, assignments and exam dont match the level of difficulty. We were expected to solve tuff questions under 1 hours with little time to take pictures of THINK. Exam questions are worded poorly.

Having this course be over is the best thing that has happened all semester. By far the hardest final exam I have ever taken. It's so heartbreaking to work your butt off for a half-decent letter grade all semester just to end up being screwed over. Strongly do not recommend taking this course. if you do prepare to be your own prof.

A classmate asked jungic if he can post the solutions to practice final and he said post your solutions first. Not even giving us the ability to compare answers. Horrible prof, I dont like him. Hes weird. 0/5 if possible. What a joke of a class. Hate it.
If this class somehow resumed back in person, I wouldnt wear my seatbelt driving there because I would rather die before making it to his class.
Dont take this prof remotely. Save yourself. If any1 else tells u other wise, its a lie.

Messy notes, intense tests with limited time, algorithms set up that confuse you, TA harsh marking, quizzes that are only 10 min yet would take 20+. To much proofs rather then apply. You can get the work right yet if you dont know why this is happening by explaining it you wouldnt get 100%. Most students watch Jamies videos. Connection issues

Im surprised a prof this bad some how still manages to get 5/5 on this platform. Usually its the students who are getting As and probably cheating/already knew most of Calculus 1. Trust me, i know people who took Calc 1 and are failing as of now. Prof J is such a horrible prod; notes r messy, connection issues, hard test, not enough time, etc.

Great professor who actively goes out to make sure you under stand the material. He individually assigned everyone a time to meet up with him after the midterm to make sure you understood the material. If you did good and understood it you were free to leave but you can stay to ask question. Best professor I've ever had and very caring.

Even though class was online and remote, Dr. J did his very best. He made sure to answer every questions and was very active on Piazza. His office hours were also very helpful, definitely recommend going as often as you can. His Tests are definitely on the harder side but doable if you study the webassign and seminar questions.

I think Dr. Jungic is finally beginning to realize on how to construct tests. The first and second test, the second test especially, used a birthday algorithm to prevent cheating. Solving the algorithm was more of a challenge than the actual test. I'm really glad he chose to hand out the algorithm before the test so we can spend time figuring itout

Test 1 was in the medium difficulty. Test 2 was hard. Test 3 was actually surprisingly easy but the TAs had to bring the average down cuz guess what THIS IS SFU. Average was 26/40 so just shows what this school cares about. This course is rigorous to. Nothing again jungic. Just hate the overall class structure and grading by the TAs. Jungic is eh

Test 3 done. What a joke. The average would have been much higher but the TAs had to b picky where it would bring everyone down. I had all my work correct yet lost so many marks for explaining that I possibly went from a 90% to a 73%. Actually so disappointed in this overall course and prof. Needs to b fixed and revised for next sem. Stay away.

Nicest guy, cares abt students, and is overall sweet. Office hours are a good idea, he has lots available too. gets off topic sometimes but he has resources for material he doesn't cover. responds to feedback + makes sure no one feels bad if they get a question wrong in class. is honest with you even if it sucks, but he is nice abt it 10/10 guy

I pay money to watch videos of another prof teach. Prof jungic put them up himself also. What a waste of money and I hate this class. SFU first year, first sem here, online, hate this already, what a money grab of a school. Such a disappointment on everything especially there rise in tuition fees for next sem. Go to ubc or kpu, sfu is such garbage.

I dont understand why he doesnt understand that we students cant do a test in under 50 min especially the way he makes it. And then the TAs r marking like their life depends on it, I dont get why theyre so strict on it, course is already dreadful and who goes to lecture now. Jamies vids r way better and I understand more. What a waste of $$$

I hate cal. Never attended his lectures for a month now, he posts Jamies videos himself which r far more cleaner and understandable. I dont understand why theres so much why we need to do this in the course rather then just apply the work. This isnt a theory and proof class, I really dislike math 150 online and based off others, I agree, avoid.

His notes are quite hard to read as his writing is messy. His connection is an issue and lag is constant throughout the online lecture. I believe in-person Jungic would b the best option but online this course is in incredibly hard as I rely more on YouTube than him. Tests are in a way where u cant cheat and so diff from the concepts we did. Avoid

Dr. J is very passionate about math, and it really shows. He's energy always wakes me up whenever I am listening to his lectures. Explains topics very clearly and always repeats himself at crucial points in the lesson so he can drill the information into our head so we don't forget. I love that aspect about his teaching and I heavily recommend him

Took him for the Spring term when the transition to online class happened. He is the most devoted prof I've had so far- he organizes as much office hours as possible and always willing to answer emails. He is approachable and very passionate about what he does. Though I admit Mulholland's videos is still the superior choice for lecture materials

All the eaters who say 5/5 for Dr. J r liars. This class is hard and prof J cant teach due to the online switch from in person. I heard he was a really good prof in-person , online its a diff story. Look at all the reviews below. Youll know what I mean. Do not take prof J or MATH 150 at all online. So many liars with the average being 55. LOL

If youve Galen AP Cal in high school, you would still average a low mark in this class. Its set up so the average is around 55-60. This class isnt curved according to Dr. Jungic so I highly recommend not to take this class with him since his notes are horrible and he doesnt even finish them. He posts YouTube videos and they are way better.

dr. J is a caring prof but is not currently doing a good job with online teaching. The exams are much harder than any practice question he assigns. with very limited time on the test it is quite unreasonable to have to spend time thinking how to arrange the questions based on the bday algorithm. I strongly suggest not taking this course.

Caring and a nice prof. Dr. J I heard was one of the best for math 150, but I feel that online is quite different for his teachings. I would highly recommend taking it with Dr.J in person. If you cant, avoid it at all costs, the class itself is quite hard and nearly a struggle for most students trying to just get over 50.

Ignore the mob mentality below. Dr. J is a very good professor - very useful lectures that helps understand the course material. Only reason why there are so many bad reviews is because he uses a unique birthday code for his tests so everyone has different values for test questions. If you put in the effort you can get an A in this course.

Extremely nice professor, but watch Mulhollands lectures alongside Jungic. Really don't understand those complaining about the birthday sequence when it was basic stuff. Literally just product rule two values and quotient rule two values. Don't expect the very basic assigned homework to be enough for the exams.

His tests r a joke. Where r the actual questions that we study through notes, assignments and seminars. Instead we have to input numbers from a table our selves and become even more confused on how to simplify whatever its asking for. Huge let down of a prof. YouTube > all the math profs especially jungic. Just know, he doesnt even finish notes.
I agree with what everyone has said. If u have to take the class, avoid prof jungic until it is in person. Hes a different person online.. in a bad way.
Hardly getting a passing grade, youtube this more useful than his lecture.

Dr. J I heard was quite well in person. Online, its a huge NO! Take this and everyone elses consideration, this class isnt the same online. Its set up in a way to constantly make u depressed and feel demotivated. Those who thrived in high school are border line passing. Avoid Dr.J, hes not what the earlier reviews seemed to b. Screw COVID.

READ what everyone has said about this class being online. Due to COVID-19, everything online is difficult and this class has been made where its much more difficult compared to in person. I highly recommend taking this class in person. Jungic leaves us to finish off the notes through YouTube and his tests r quite confusing. Overall, Avoid it.

Dr. J is a caring professor but his online exam system is horrible. Its hard enough knowing material but his personal spin on the test makes it so u have to insert numbers and functions into questions, just over complicating everything. Terrible experience.

This class is extremely difficult. Dr. J is a caring prof but that is not enough to get you through this course. Notes are always incomplete and I heavily rely on youtube. Assigned questions and notes are barely relevant to questions on exams. You will need to put all your effort in to fail with 49%

Jungic is a nice person, although taking this course online with Jungic is near impossible and will certainly drive you insane. You will spend so many hours every day studying for this course just to fail every single exam. The exams are insanely confusing and completely unrelated to the material taught in the class. Avoid this class at all costs!

Dr. Jungic is a super helpful and nice person, whenever I ask him a question he gets back to me as soon as he can and always wants the best for the students, however, he doesn't mean he's good at teaching online. He never finishes his notes on time and just tells us to do it ourselves. The tests are not even related to anything thought in class.
Jungic tests are made to be cheat proof but instead makes the tests wording very confusing and unnecessarily difficult on top of the already tough test.
Dont take this prof.
This is for sure a gpa booster.

Dont get me started with online school. I think since its online, Jungic is struggling in teaching and understanding that we students have more than 1 class. Doing all this practice and then seeing the test have things we never covered just shows how bad his teaching ability is online. Beware, take this class in person for a good mark.

This class killed me. Such a pointless class. I used YouTube most of the time in teaching myself the concept, which werent even on the test. Instead. BDAY sequence was. Dont take this class online, its incredibly hard. Prof jungic doesnt make it easier with his inability to complete notes and constant mistakes and horrible hand writing.

Notes r a joke, u learn the basics , and the test is something else. If u need to take this class, I recommend someone else. If YOUR A 1st YEAR, TAKE IT WHEN CLASS RESUMES IN PERSON!!! THIS CLASS IS DREADFUL ONLINE! TAs DONT CARE EITHER, AVERAGE IN HIS CLASS IS AROUND 50%
What a joke.

Online -> incredibly hard. Wait until this class is in person. Cant understand veselins notes , Youtube is what is keeping me on border line pass. This class has messed with my confidence. I feel like crying because of him. He gives you so much non - related review and the test is something else. Trust me, trust the others, take it with diff prof

Absolute waste of time going to class. Jamies video JUNGIC himself uploads is 10x better than his notes. Tests r way to hard, u cant prepare for a test that goes completely off book. He says the final will b calculus 2 level which makes no sense. This class is calculus + REVIEW but the review is so bad. Just wait until the class resumes in person

This class is so bad online, impossible to understand anything. Veselins writing is so bad and makes so many mistakes in his work. Doesnt finish the notes, expects u to know why it works rather than doing the actual solving. TAs mark harshly , expected to keep the class mark below the average of 55. NO CURVE!!!! I 100% not recommend this prof.

Do textbook questions, do his webassign work, do the seminar questions, do the optional review, and the TEST will have nothing to do with it. DONT BE FOOLED by test 1, it wasnt that bad , TEST 2 was something else and he said it only gets harder from here. Do not take this class ONLINE WITH JUNGIC , WAIT UNTIL IT RESUMES IN PERSON!!!!!

AVOID THIS PROF FOR ONLINE MATH 150!!! He doesnt finish the notes and u have to go to Jamies videos after on YouTube to complete it and understand it.
