Handing in assignments and TESTS R INCREDIBLY HARD. Our class has told him to stop with the nonsense and he believes its just us who dont understand. A prof who doesnt care. AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!
He's a great teacher but his tests are very unconventional. The class average is pretty low due to this.

Just a heads up, if you take Math 150 with this prof and it's online, know that the test questions tend to be convoluted and only loosely related to the lectures/assignments. Prepare yourself. Or don't, because it makes no difference.

I can't believe this, but I only chose this Professor because of the reviews here. His online lectures do not cover ALL the topics in a section and I have to watch Mulholland's YouTube videos instead. Really? Tuition for Youtube? Not only that but his tests do NOT cover foundational textbook and web assign practice/concepts.

Maybe since its online Its hard to understand compared to in class. Just handing in assignments and keeping up with lectures. Veselin Jungic was rated such a high prof yet the only thing I rely on is the additional YouTube videos of Jamie he has up. Highly recommend to avoid this class until it resumes back in person. TAs also mark way to hard.
He's such a bro. So soft and caring, I'm glad that he's my professor.
An absolute gem of a prof. If you have the chance to take a class with Dr.J, I highly recommend it. He is always willing to help students with questions no matter how difficult or easy they are.

He. Is. Amazing. Don't miss out on any chances of having his class because he is the most caring and helpful prof you can ever get. He loves what he teaches and that makes his lectures so much more interesting. Tests are very fair, work for it and you'll get by fine. Go to his office hours, he'll explain all your questions clear as day

Dr. J is the best Math teacher I have had ever. He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. I found his office hours to be particularly useful, as he is good at explaining math one on one. He will assign a fair amount of homework and the exams were pretty hard I found. Put in the effort, and it will be worth it!

Dr J is a great choice for a notoriously difficult class. He is a kind and caring professor and wont talk down to you if you're stuck. If his office hours don't work for you he is happy to accommodate. No iclickers, homework is online via webassign and crowdmark, quizzes are weekly with questions pulled directly from that section's assignments.

Fantastic professor, he tries to remember everyones name during seminars, and gives good feedback. His office hours are great when you're struggling. Calc 1 is a tough course, and he tries his best to ensure that you study and practice for exams. Overall, a great professor, I would definitely take the course again.

He is one of the best prof/ teacher I've ever had, if you have the option to be his student- take it! He's very caring and if you ever need help he is always there. I recommened getting to know this prof bc he is a true gem of SFU. Keep up with your work and always ask for help when you need to and you will most likely end up with a decent mark.

Has him for Math 100 as well. He explains things very clearly and if you don't understand it still, he'll go over it again till you do. He also heavily encourages questions and participation. Before each exam, he gives you a practice exam that's VERY representative of the one he'll give on exam day, so you should know what to expect.
Awesome prof. If you need help he is there to welcome you into his office and go over anything you do not understand. Exams were pretty challenging, but nothing special. Very, VERY fair grader.
excellent prof, exams and midterms very reasonable and he was very willing to help any problems students had
Best prof at SFU. Extremely helpful, teaches at the right pace and explains everything. Welcomes in-class questions. Holds regular office hours and is very approachable. He's very friendly too.

I had him for Math 150 online. He was knowledgeable for sure, but made many simple mistakes that threw me off for a few minutes, making me miss new things he was teaching because he was say adding instead of subtracting.
I've always hated math, until i took calc 1 with him. He's THE best prof i ever had. Really helpful, gets to know the students. All in all. Awesome prof

Dr. Jungic is truly a gift from the heavens! Calculus I is not an easy course and having it at 8:30 am makes it all the more the harder - however, Dr. Jungic has approached every lecture a sense of charisma that can make one excited about learning math! He really cares about students and it clearly shines through!
it is not a very tricky business that out of the ~40 profs i've had, he's the best.
Funny teacher, sounds really cool. Sample midterms are very similar to actual midterms and are not too hard, but the final was much more difficult compared to them.
